dcterms:title: Increased cellular senescence in doxorubicin-induced murine ovarian injury: effect of senolytics
dcterms:abstract: Ovarian injury caused by chemotherapy can lead to early menopause, infertility, and even premature senility in female cancer patients. We hypothesized that the chemotherapy drug, doxorubicin, could increase senescent cell burden in ovarian tissue and that elimination of senescent cells with senolytics would ameliorate doxorubicin-induced ovarian injury. Our data demonstrated an accumulation of cellular senescence in doxorubicin-treated ovaries. However, senolytics did not reverse the ovarian dysfunction indicated by significant follicle loss and stromal fibrosis post-treatment.
